title: How to make the ai vehicle in Beamng start moving at a specific moment
body:
Hi, I have a vehicle ‘veh_control’ and an AI vehicle 'veh_ai' in my scenaro.  I want the 'veh_ai 'vehicle starts moving when the veh_control vehicle reaches to a specific position. I tried to use the following code to achieve it, but I failed. Can you give me some suggestions or are there any other ways to realize it? Looking forward to your reply. Thanks!


`scenario = Scenario('smallgrid', 'test')`

`veh_control = Vehicle('ego_vehicle', model='etk800', licence='control')`
`veh_ai = Vehicle('ai_vehicle', model='etki', licence='auto')`

`electrics = Electrics()`
`veh_control.attach_sensor('electrics', electrics)`

`timer = Timer()`
`veh_control.attach_sensor('timer', timer)`

`posControl = (0, -100, 0.4)`
`posAi = (0, -100 + 10, 0.4)`

`scenario.add_vehicle(veh_control, pos=(0, 0, 1), rot=(0, 0, 0))`
`scenario.add_vehicle(veh_ai, pos=(0, 10, 1), rot=(0, 0, 0))`

`scenario.make(beamng)`
`beamng.load_scenario(scenario)`

`beamng.teleport_vehicle(veh_control.vid, posControl, rot=(0, 0, 0))`
`beamng.teleport_vehicle(veh_ai.vid, posAi, rot=(0, 0, 0))`
`beamng.switch_vehicle(veh_control)`
`beamng.start_scenario()`

`def getAiScript(orig=(0, -10, 0),tt=0):
    script = list()
    for i in range(60):
        node = {
            'x': orig[0],
            'y': -i * 30 + orig[1],
            'z': orig[2],
            't': i+tt,
        }
        script.append(node)
    return script`

`        sensors = beamng.poll_sensors(veh_cont)`
`        veh_cont.update_vehicle()`
`        pos0 = veh_cont.state['pos']`
